Reviews.Title: “I will go again :)”
Reviews.Author: MOHAMED E
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a perfect location, very close to city center for shopping, a lot of sightseeing places are around, the windows are very sunny, hotel is very clean, rooms are not very big, but reasonable, toilet is clean and convenient, LCD TV is good, mini bar is good, breakfast is great, staff are cheerful and very helpful, free Wi Fi is available, you can request anything from the staff and they will help you for sure, room service is quick, housekeeping is perfect, Casa Batllo and La Pedrera are very close to visit, Picasso Museum is not so far, Las Ramblas is 10 minutes walking, Elcortes Ingles is 5 minutes away. I adore the hotel and if I visited Barcelona again I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PanaEn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location near everything a turist must see and it is also very near the metro. I will for sure book this hotel again when I visit Barcelona again! The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, friendly, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Achilles07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family after the business portion of my stay at another nearby hotel ended. We moved here to get into a larger room to accommodate the family and get a bit more vacation-like luxury. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was quite large and well appointed with a king bed, flat screen TV, large marble bath with amenities, mini fridge to hold our own snacks, and a large window overlooking the rear of the hotel. I suggest you ask for a rear-facing room to avoid the darker street front and noise and to also avoid the rooms that open to the internal atrium which has no natural light or air. We were able to open our window to the sun and fresh air because we faced the rear. The rooms are quiet, but a bit hot - not sure why and I've seen others complain about that, too. The staff is very friendly which is good because you have to visit the front desk every 24 hours to get a new WiFi password. One of the best parts of the experience was the hotel's proximity to Passeig De Gracia for shopping, restaurants and Metro access. I did tons of research before settling on this place to meet my price and location requirements, and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service but a few comments”
Reviews.Author: Joachim73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just north of the La Rambla and also for me on business could walk to the fair I attended in the morning. The hotel was clean, friendly staff, complementary WLAN and rooms were ok. Still, my main criterias which I look for in a hotel when I travel on business were not fulfilled apart from location. The beds were hard and the pillows very uncomfortable. The airconditioning did not work. It made a lot of noise but no cool air came. The breakfast also was substandard given the rate paid and yes I do realise that its Spain but in comparison not so good even for Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfectly OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeniorishTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a superb location. Central to, well, everything. A block or two to the metro; easy walking distance to La Rambla and of course great restaurants abound. It is, in my opinion, a perfectly fine business person's hotel. The lobby is simple; really just a meeting place. The staff are young, friendly and generally helpful. Because we were there with a large family group we got to see a lot of rooms. Some were better than others; one, billed as non-smoking, smelled terrible. Another had no apparent mechanism to remove moisture from the bathroom so it was musty; but the other five rooms we were just fine.Clean and comfortable. No views, but for the price, it's a more than a good deal. We left Barcelona for awhile and then came back -- to the same hotel -- so we voted with our wallets as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LJS13
Reviews.Content: We checked in with our adult daughter to a room that easily accommodated three of us. We were thrilled with the location as we could walk to virtually every site we wanted to visit save two. The hotel is just a half block off of Paseo de Gracia, and near many of the fabulous Gaudi homes and other structures. We also discovered fabulous restaurants just a walk away, as well as Crusto, an amazing bakery with wonderful breakfast breads and coffees (one night we bought sandwiches here and ate al fresco). To demonstrate how amazing the hotel is, here is an example. I always carry a fan with me. We left for the day and at some point I realized my fan was missing (I'd had it with me when we left our room). When we returned hours later I mentioned that I'd lost my fan, never imagining I'd dropped it in the hotel. Surprise! The desk clerk said the maids had found it in the hall near the elevator and there it was. The desk staff speak english and made every effort to be of help to us. It's a lovely setting and a pleasure to stay here. One caveat: the breakfast is extra and as with most hotels in Europe it is quite pricey. We enjoyed finding our bakery which was delicious and affordable! So pass on taking breakfast and wander knowing you will return to this lovely oasis in the hustle bustle of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A few days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ireland082
Reviews.Content: An ideal location for a stay in Barcelona. The hotel was comfortable and fairly central for everything we wanted to do. We were there in late October and it was comfortable but I do think that the lack of air-con could make it unbearable in the middle of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locattion, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelIsrael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, room size is OK, breakfast selcection good (did not llke their coffee), free WIFI. The location of this hotel is the best thing about it, just a few meters from the wonderful Paseo de Gracia, and walking distance to Plaza Catalunia. What I did not like is the hotel ambience and decoration, somewhat outdated and gloomy.

Reviews.Title: “A good centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MtnMatt1749
Reviews.Content: The service in the hotel was very good. A cab ride is about 35euro from the airport. I had a small room with a double bed. It was only big enough for one person, but well laid out with a nice bathroom. It is walking distant to many tourist areas and close to the metro lines. The beach takes a little more effort to get to. There is no pool or fitness center. The restaurant and bar are simple and nice, but not a party spot. I like the breakfast buffet, one of the better ones I have had. The dinners were good and pricing is what one would expect in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short break”
Reviews.Author: AnnieC_11
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at this hotel based solely on previous comments made by other tripadvisor members. I was a little worried because I had used Airmiles and thought I'd be given a dump of a room. How wrong was I? The Hotel room itself (room 508) was small but perfect. It had a wonderfully spotless bathroom, mini bar, flat screen tv and the bed had lovely crisp white linen. The hotel is well located and within walking distance of the main sights (Casa Mila, La Pedrera, Sagrada Familia, Museu Picasso) and is ideally placed for Placa de Catalunya which is where the airport bus starts and terminates. You can also easily walk to Las Ramblas and to Barceloneta which is where the beach is. Being a Londoner, I was on my guard for any potential muggings but I can honestly say that I felt completely safe especially where the hotel is located. I got caught in some football traffic on my second day and got back to the hotel really late. Even though the hotel is on a side street - I didn't fear for my safety at all. The only negative comment that I would make (but didn't affect me personally) is that I would not have paid 20Euros for the breakfast. Luckily my stay included the buffet breakfast and it was more than adequate for me. It kept me so full I couldnt eat again until the evening!! But 20 Euros is a bit steep in my opinion. There are numerous places in the area where you can buy breakfast a lot cheaper. If you are on a really tight budget, empty your mini bar fridge - and stock up with goodies from the Carrefour supermarket on Las Ramblas. You will save a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible attitude of general manager !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hagim
Reviews.Content: We made an order by email for 2 double rooms for 5 nights 9-14 September. Terms sent to us were 24 hours cancellation or first night payment. Credit card was sent as garantee, At check in we were aksed to pay for the full 5 days in advance. This is exceptional, insulting, and we did not met such a demand anywhere else. Moreover, it was not in the terms sent to us. We came to an agreement with the receptionist that we shall pay each morning for the next day. Then a man came and started shouting in Spanish at the receptionist and later at us in English. He shouted: " either you pay for the five days now or you go out of the hotel now!" then he added: "you have no chance of getting another room here in Barcelona, since I am the general manager of all hotels in the city center!" This man was the general manager of HCC hotels: Mr. Joan Asensio Ros. Of course we left. This incident ruined our planed vacation in Barcelona. Be aware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really well located for a short trip to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NigelC1959
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at this hotel and enjoyed the experience very much. The room was well appointed, clean and modern. The reception staff were all very helpful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. We were able to walk to many of the sights we wanted to see on a short three night break. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Darrell W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from all the action and all the tourist sights are within easy reach. You can walk to La Ramblas and Catalunya Square within 5 mins and the nearest underground is only round the other corner. The rooms are very well equipped with good air con and there was no noise at all coming up from the street. The breakfast was excellent and the only thing i could really complain about if i tried hard is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. I knew about this when i booked so its not really a complaint. I would recommend this hotel no problem and definitely use it again. The staff were fantastic and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it even better this second time”
Reviews.Author: dbeeson
Reviews.Content: My first time was in July 2009, I had a paid reservation through Asiativ (a scam booking site) and upon showing up at my hotel, there was no reservation. This hotel suggested me to check out HCC St. Moritz, one of the only hotels of the category that still had rooms available. When I arrived smoke coming out of my ears and I told them my story, they gave me an excellent room and an upgrade as to relax and calm down. Spacious room, very clean and very welcoming personnel (and drink). This year, I decided to stay again for a couple of days, same excellent personnel, same service, same welcome drink, same upgrade to an even better room. Although being right in the noisy Cataluña sq. area, the hotel is located in a fairly quiet street just across from a great Thai restaurant and 5 min walk from the Plaza Cataluña's subway and airport bus. Very good value too. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the food and the service”
Reviews.Author: Joanmac2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights prior to departing on a cruise from Barcelona, but had booked elsewhere for a further 3 nights after the cruise, and were very glad that we did. . On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location for exploring Barcelona, being just off Passeig de Gracia. It is clean and comfortable, albeit I felt the décor, while stylish, was a bit dark and, to my mind, gloomy. However, we were not impressed with either the service or the food. When we arrived, there was no-one to help us get our cases up the front steps – apparently it was the porter’s day off, but I find it hard to believe a 91 room, 4 star hotel has only one porter! The receptionist was not exactly welcoming either. Buffet breakfast was charged at 20 euros per person, and was nothing special. We decided to have dinner in the hotel restaurant on our second night. The fact that the restaurant was empty should have been a giveaway – there was only a very limited menu and the food was awful. Our starters were decidedly iffy – the ‘home-made tuna pie’ looked more like something you would buy in Greggs (no offence to Greggs, but they don’t purport to be a 4 start hotel). Our main courses were so bad we sent them back and left, especially as the restaurant manager refused to come and speak to us. All in all we were very disappointed with what could otherwise have been a perfectly decent hotel, but were very glad that we did not have to return there after our cruise. We went instead to the Torre Catalunya which was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic localtion”
Reviews.Author: KYLDN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a family city break to Barcelona. Can only rate it highly. Staff were incredibly helpful and pleasant and the room was spacious and very clean. Best part of all was the location. Minutes from La Ramblas and just around the corner from the hub of the fashion district, but not affected by noise at night. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to be upgraded to this hotel from another one in the group. No reason was given we assume overbooking. after a short cab ride from the original hotel ( paid for by the company ) We arrived at the St. Moritz and were greeted politely and helpfully our room was already available despite our early ( pre noon ) arrival. From start to finish our stay was most enjoyable.The staff were always helpful and eager to please.The room was very comfortable and the standard of cleaning was top notch. just two minor gripes. The air conditioning in our room was not particularly effective and I was disappointed to be charged Euro 7 for a key to use the room safe. Overall we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: barcelonia
Reviews.Content: WE booked this hotel after looking through lots of reviews of hotels in Barcelonia. We were not disappointed. I had emailed the hotel to tell them it was our honeymoon. We were greeted with champagne and chocolates which was alovely gesture. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was clean and airy and the breakfast buffet was very nice. All in all a great hotel for the price and ideally situated.

Reviews.Title: “great, great and more great”
Reviews.Author: Shalako7058
Reviews.Content: I searched extensively to source the best priced hotel and read many reviews, With trepidation i booked this hotel and was not to be disappointed. The hotel is situated a little off Las Ramblas, which is very good if you need a good nights sleep. From booking in to leaving we where subjected to a very good service by the staff and given many bits of information which were very helpful. Booking in was smove and the room was clean ansd modern, room 316 at the front, there was a small balconey to sit and relax at. Room service was good serving our request very quickly. All staff were polite and on the ball. On booking out I was concerned that because we had a late flight we would have to pay to store our luggage but no we were offered a space in thier secure locked room until whenever we needed it. All in All 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, superb location, lovely staff, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: billyboy68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at this hotel. First impressions, the hotel was recently modernised. Has got a nice modern feel to it, and is very clean and well presented. Reception staff are an asset to this hotel, they were very friendly, informative, and give the impression that they really want us to enjoy your stay. They also gave us some good concessions for some of the attractions too. Our room was 509, right at the top of the building facing the front. We were a bit concerned about the noise, but this was definetely not an issue. The room was decorated in a modern style and a lot of thought was obviously put into it's design. I've stayed in some terrific hotels worldwide, usually find that the biggest let-down is the bed. The bed in our room was absolutely terrific. It was perfect!. Had the best night sleep I could have away from home!. All in all, I can't fault the room at all. It was incredibly quiet. Rooms have big solid doors so you can't even hear people in the hall. A very peaceful and quiet room. Bathroom was lovely too. Only have one gripe (otherwise I would have given them 5 out of 5)...was the continental breakfast over the weekend... the coffee was just awful!!!!! The worst of the worst! Noticed on our last day (monday), that they give a hot breakfast option - made to order, for some strange reason didn't have this Sat/Sun. If they changed the coffee to something better, and offered hot breakfast on the weekend, I think it would be rather perfect. But don't take my word for it, try it for yourself. I would like to come back next year for sure hopefully they will take up my suggestion..

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Desdor
Reviews.Content: We booked a six night stay here and what a mistake that turned out to be. The sound insulation is really poor so that we were troubled by loud television noise late at night. Some of the staff on reception were helpful but overall service was particularly bad. Returning to our room one evening we found that the room hadn't been made up. On another occasion, for some mysterious reason, soap and shower gel was removed from our room. A request for replacements was ignored. Repeated phone calls eventually produced a result. Halfway through our stay a party started up next door. It turned out that we were next door to a function room despite having asked for and been promised a quiet room. The noise was so intolerable that they moved us to a smaller dingier room. There was no apology and no offer of compensation. Breakfast is poor value at €40.00 per couple plus tax. Get it locally for less than half that or better still choose a different. hotel. You can get a much better four star hotel that the St Moritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Putci
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Could not be better for Barcelona. And still very quite street. The location in the middle between the Rambla and the Gracia is the right point for 4 days trip in the city. The hotel room is excellent - big. nice, clean, good bath room. The personal are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good as well. Its price compared to the benefits is low. I think that for a couple this should be first choice if there is a place.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, But Close to the Action!”
Reviews.Author: Calif_traveler_11
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we were offered a room at the St. Moritz through overbooking at another HCC hotel. Our room faced Diputacio yet the dual-pane window - which could be opened - kept street noise out at night. The room was clean and modern.and obviously well maintained. While the weather wasn't oppressive in early June, the air conditioning was welcome and cooled the room impressively fast. The beds - twins pushed together - were firm but not uncomfortably so. The flat screen TV worked, but, honestly, there is too much to do in Barcelona to watch TV! the small refrigerator was well stocked if you need that. The hotel is two blocks from P. Catalunya where there is a Metro stop as well as one of the main Tourist Information offices. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant so can't review that, but there are many, many places to eat near P. Catalunya. We enjoyed the tapas at a Basque place nearby. Wifi worked in the room for our iPod, but not our laptop. This issue was solved by the hotel staff by providing us with an ethernet cable so we could connect to the hotel's wired network. A quiet, well staffed, hotel two blocks from the Ramblas was an excellent introduction to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious”
Reviews.Author: beatricet
Reviews.Content: we arrived to this hotel "by chance" because the one where we had booked the room was full and they moved us to st moritz. the rooms are beautiful, big, the bathroom was clean and brightful, there was a big tv. the breakfast was very good and there were anything you wanted. the hotel is quite near the center (along passeig de gracia) and near the the underground stop and casa battlò. very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daleza
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect, less than 5 minute walk to placa catalunya. The hotel itself was very nice. The room was spacious and well decorated, the breakfast was good and the reception staff very helpful. We stayed over Easter weekend and if returning to Barcelona would book this hotel again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very good but little bit old”
Reviews.Author: hkutravel
Reviews.Content: Hcc Moritz is a hotel in a great location , three minutes to the metro station Passeig de Gracia.The hotel provide free wifi (In the room) and it is very fast.The room is clean and cozy. The air-conditioner is very good. The staff is good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon187062
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff Buffet breakfast average air conditioning not switched on when we went hence rooms hot and window opened inside may be better in summer

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ... Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thoris
Reviews.Content: Service, cleanliness, location and sleep quality were great! Very close to all amenities. The Ramblas action is a short walk away as is some of the best tapas in all of Barcelona. Hotel staff were eager to assist us anytime we had a question. No food or parking, but this is very normal for Barcelona. Would definitely revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gili_S
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is big and popular city, it is not easy to find the hotel that suits for you. However, after some search, comparing prices and location we have decided to book this hotel for few nights city break in Barcelona. This Hotel St.Moritz at Calle Diputacio street was our choice which was very good one. To most places, the city center, the restaurants, pubs, shopping and so on we could just take a walk. We could also come back to the hotel for siesta and rest before getting back out for dinner and a drink. The hotel itself wasn’t any special, but the service was kind and friendly, room was comfortable and good breakfast was included. Free WiFi access was available upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Gianni1701
Reviews.Content: We spent three night at the St. Moritz and loved every minute. It was clean and warm and the staff were friendly and helpful. An excellent buffet breakfast was included. The room was a reasonable size with comfortable twin beds pushed together to make a double, an arrangement that worked surprisingly well. The bathroom was well appointed with a very good shower. Location of the St Moritz is first class - a five minute walk from each of the Metro, buses at Placa Catalunya and La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Decent old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: jefi99
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok, but a bit oldfashioned. Flat screen TV. Some rooms have balconies. Rooms facing the street can be a bit noisy. Hotel could need a fresh up. Bathrooms have bathtub. Breakfast is mediocre. Small bar area next to the restaurant. There is a pub across the street, and some tapas restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Personnel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PennyTraveler52
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until the time we left, we had nothing but great service. All of the personnel were friendly, helpful and sometimes with our group, very patient. The location was perfect for us, it was off the main street but close to everything. We had the Metro less than a block away. We were just off the main street of Passeig de Gracia and only a block away from La Rambla. I don't think we found a bad place to eat the whole time we were there. Our only precaution would be, when you ask directions make sure you understand if they are talking about their left or yours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: San_Love2travel
Reviews.Content: Nice large room, quiet as facing into the terrace, only draw back no outside facing window but could see weather through dome sky light. Friendly reception staff, very helpful and willing to suggest visits restaurants etc. Maids very good and friendly. Comfortable beds, lovely soft fresh linnen, although you may need an extra pillow, no problem. Modern styled. Good location just off passig de gracia close to top of La Rambla with bus, taxi and metro main stops, about 3 minute walk in total - 25 minute walk to harbor. Didn't try breakfast but plenty of cafes etc close by any way. Barcelona was fab and this hotel delivered what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: SSMcK
Reviews.Content: Positives...relatively quiet location yet minutes from the heart of the city and all amenities; very friendly and helpful staff; our 4th floor room was quiet, spacious and very comfortable; air con did it's job! Limited negatives...mini bar was pricey (but didn't have any need of it); 7 Euros per night for the use of the room safety deposit box. As far as breakfast was concerned, the spread was completely adequate whilst the breakfast staff were very efficient and friendly. We would happily use the hotel again, especially if we could get room 401.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - good quality & services - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nzwccw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walking distant to La Ramble. It's a very good location - close to Metro, restaurants, etc. The staff were excellent. Our room was a very good size compared to other European hotels of the same class. But there was a slight cigarette smell when we first entered the room. Sheets & beddings were all very clean. Breakfast was ok - not a big selection of food but can't be too fuss. I'd stay here again next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “2 American ladies say, 'great location, clean room, friendly staff'”
Reviews.Author: journeyon123
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were planning a trip to Barcelona. With the help of trip advisor, we found this hotel, read the reviews and looked at the pictures. We were a bit disappointed with the lobby construction. The pictures made the hotel seem quaint and we expected the marble staircase in the lobby to add to the hotel's charm. This however was our only disapointment. We had a clean room (looked clean and smelled clean). The twin beds were somewhat comfortable and the bathroom was large enough for our toiletries. The staff was friendly and gave us suggestions when we asked. The location was outstanding because the area is wonderful and yet it was also close enough to walk to the more touristy places. Also, the metro station is very close if you are not interested in walking. This hotel is a great value for the cleanliness, location and staff. It is not a 'four star' hotel by American standards due to the lack of amenities. I will most certainly consider staying at this hotel again when I visit beautiful Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: karatekid4805
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean,staff very very friendly.Food good ,near the centre

Reviews.Title: “You Pay For the Location”
Reviews.Author: Aich
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location in a classy part of the town but withing walking distance of the attractions in the center and close to the metro. Reception area could do with a revamp but the rooms are OK and modern but those opening on the inner part are a bit dim....if you are there in the day. Not as cheap as further out.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms and Great Locale!”
Reviews.Author: BritFrenchPol
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person when it comes to choosing hotels. I liked this one for its location (side street away from loud late night bars and close to transportation) and the great internet rate (non-refundable). We were pleasantly surprised by the brisk, helpful service and enormous room. It was spotless and quiet. The desk staff were pleasant and very helpful in providing all our needs for sightseeing, restaurants. The bed, on my European Hard Hotel Bed Scale (1 concrete to 5 comfy), was a 2. Water pressure was fabulous! Breakfast was not a part of the room rate, and at 20 EU was steep for the run-of-the-mill pastries, cold meats, and cereal. We ate in the restaurant for dinner our first night and it was the worst meal of our entire trip for me. Canned vegetables paired with a lovely piece of Talapia, and the starter was the saltiest cheese-on-toast ever. So pass on the restaurant (bistro choices).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clubmanEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Moritz for 3 nights on a weekend break with my wife. We spent ages trying to find the right hotel in the right area, the St Moritz filled all the categories. It is 5 mins walk from where the Aerobus from the airport stops in Placa Catalunya, just off the main shopping area of Passieg de Gracia and close to the Rambla. Plenty of bars and restaurants around but a one to mention is the Bracafe which is just off the main street of De Gracia and Navarra Tapas bar on the corner. Its a small cafe, good coffee and drinks great snacks and very inexpensive. The Hotel was very helpful spoke English which was a help and the room warm and comfortable. We had breakfast as part of our deal which was an excellent buffet. Dont go seeking elsewhere this ticks all the boxes. John, North East England

Reviews.Title: “Safe area near Las Ramblas with American-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: lakez34
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the few European hotels I have encountered that are in the 3-4 star range that have American-sized rooms. Large comfortable bed (might have been a king but most likely a queen - don't really remember) with plenty of space around it. Clean and open hallways with an elevator large enough to fit two people and their luggage. Room was facing an interior courtyard area, but still remained quiet. Bathroom was well-furnished with a good quality tub and shower setup. Located just a few blocks from Las Ramblas and next to a major bus stop for one of the Airport buses making it easy for sightseeing travelers. Plenty of shops and restaurants located within 5 minutes of the hotel, and unlike some of the other parts of Las Ramblas, this area felt totally safe at night. Only real negative would be the lack of A/C which I was told would not be available except for the summer months - the room was ridiculously warm even with the window being open. Good value for the price - I spent about $90 per night for a 3-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarolGP
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there with my girlfriend from 1st to 5th of October. Hotel was absolutely great!!!!! very nice and helpful staff (especially receptionist Vanessa and luggage porter). Couldnt have imagined better location - exactly in the center of the city.. very quiet and spacious rooms, amazingly comfy beds and proper, fresh and tasty breakfast. We ve read some reviews saying that hotel is really 3* but in fact it was proper 4 star with impressive lobby area [i guess that this is standard for barcelona] and great customer service. We'll definitely stay there again on our next trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star On Quiet Block Near the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: maerose
Reviews.Content: Our air/hotel/cruise travel package included a 2 night hotel stay in Barcelona, at the HCC St Moritz, in a great location: on a quiet block just off the Passeig de Gracia, 3 blocks up from the Ramblas, an easy walk to restaurants, shops, public transportation, etc. Exc. checkin/checkout, good service. Our package included the buffet breakfast, which was fairly good & w many health food alternatives, including soy drinks, almond milk, gluten free choices, besides the usual offerings. [I hear the buffet bkfst is quite expensive when not included in the room rate, but there are alternatives: lots of coffee shops on the Passeig de Gracia -- even a Dunkin' Donuts two blocks down]. The room was small, in the European style, but clean & quiet, as was the bathroom. There's a computer in the lobby for guest use. We visit Barcelona often and would definitely stay here again, but check the internet first for the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all aspects”
Reviews.Author: jeromezz
Reviews.Content: excellent part of Barcelona, international guests, great location

Reviews.Title: “Few problems, generally o.k”
Reviews.Author: chrisro55
Reviews.Content: As has been said before was 4* when opened, is now a moderate 3* at best Good points · Location is fantastic 1 minutes walk from Passeig de Gracia & the Metro, or within easy walking access to some of the main sights and a leisurely stroll down to Las Ramblas · Staff friendly & helpful with good command of English · Rear facing rooms sunny and quite, well stocked and kept clean Bad points · On the first night we were given room 318, avoid this room at all costs as it is located directly next to the lift shaft and associated plant room, leading to noise all night and very little sleep · Twin beds pushed together, mattresses / pillows of low quality ·€20 E for buffet continental breakfast, we declined this offer!!, complete waste of money as there are a wide selection of coffee shops and patisseries on the Passeig de Gracia

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: T8T
Reviews.Content: This was probably a 4* hotel when it first opened, but now it's a little worn. Still, the room was clean and comfortable and the staff were excellent. Our only gripe was that we had twin beds pushed together instead of a double.

Reviews.Title: “OK - I'm sure there's better hotels in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: trinity2104
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I originally booked the HCC Covadonga. We arrived at the HCC Covadonga about 4pm, this was after trekking it from the Hospital Clinic Metro station (which incidentally is about 15 minutes away - a bit too much especially with luggage and in 30 degrees celcius!). From the reading the reviews here, it appears that the HCC hotels havea habit of "upgrading" their guests to the so called 4 star hotels - Covadonga is listed as a 3 stars and we were told on arrival that the hotel was double booked and so therefore, we were to be transferred to St Moritz. The taxi was called and paid for by the hotel and to our surprise a doorman greeted us. The staff were very friendly but we did get annoyed when they told us that they didn't have a double bed room available (especially when the staff at Covadonga assured us that our booking would be exactly the same but in a 4 star hotel!). They originlly offered us a non-smoking room with 2 beds pushed together. However, after not much wrangling, we were given a smoking room on the top floor which had a double bed. Despite the room being a smoking room, it did not smell (although, the hair dryer was blowing out smokey hot air - have no idea why this was!). The room is a little worn around the edges, it does get hot in the room because you have to use your door card to activate the power (incidentally, we were given 2 door cards and so we left one of them in the slot to keep the room cool) and it is on the small size. However, the main problem with the room was the noise. The street outside constantly has traffic and if not traffic, the bin collection will keep you awake untill 1am. We also had the misfortune of having a dodgy window which didn't close properly. However, luckily for us, we're not light nor early sleepers and so sleeping was not a problem. Travelling to the hotel: This hotel was better located than Covadonga. It's location in fact is excellent. We didn't use the buses but instead used the train and metro system. On arrival from the airport, take the Renfe train (you need to walk all the way to the end of Terminal B, go up the escalators and walk through the overhead walkway to the train station) to Passaig de Gracie (one stop after Barcelona Sants). The hotel is located on the street with the shops "Camper" and "Vogue" on the corner (make sure you're walking away from "Zara". The great thing about Barcelona and staying at this particular hotel is that if you take a wrong turn, you don't need to back track - the checkerboard roads just mean you need to keep turning right or left and you get back to where you were - a good trick if you're too embarrased to walk pass the doorman because you've taken a wrong turn! Travelling tips: We bought ourselves the Barcelona Card which gave us free travel on the metro, train and bus system for the duration of our stay. It had various free coupons to be used for the museums and sites. Food: We recommend the restaurant Salamanca in Barceloneta. When you get to Barceloneta metro station, keep walking straight towards the beach. Once you are there, turn left and keep walking about 100 yeards. They do the best seafood paella in town and at a good price and HUGE portions! A meal for 2 (without wine) cost us around €50. Sites: Tibidoga - this we found by chance! Everyone goes to Mont Juic but this place is just as good - without the masses of tourists! There's an amusement park up here but don't be deterred - there's a beautiful and stunning church and the site of Barcelona from up here is absolutely breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: mamasad
Reviews.Content: They put charges on my credit card that were false - do not stay here. The staff clearly lied when we questioned it. Steer clear there are plently of other places to stay in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel /great location”
Reviews.Author: cbmopar
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the ST. Moritz Nov 16th thru 20th. Nice hotel in a great location, close to Las Rablas and 1/2 block from Pasea de Gracia the grand shopping street. We stayed at this hotel thru a Volvo overseas delivery side trip. It is not a 4 star hotel as it is listed as one. It is a bit pricey for the extra night we paid for. the beds are hard as a rock, be prepared if you have a back problem as I do. We had a street room that could be noisy at times. The room was hot, we had to open the windows every time we came back to the room. You have to insert your room card in a slot on the wall to activate the power to the room, like the lights and the air conditioner. When you leave the ac shuts off! Even though it was Nov. the outside air temp was 70F and we were on the 4th floor. I will shop around next time for a more comfortable hotel. The staff was very helpful and there was no language barrier. The room was clean but looked a bit worn.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: trvler111
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to metro. Bed is okay, two singles pushed together. Shower and bathroom are nice. Room was uncomfortably hot and there was no A/C because it had been turned off for the season; windows don't open. No clock in the room, and the power goes out when you leave, so don't plan on charging up any batteries or anything while you're out. Minibar is of course extremely expensive, but so is breakfast. Sound proofing inside the hotel isn't very good. Only slept about 4 hours a night despite being exhausted. This did not feel like a four-star hotel. Maybe spoiled by better-value US hotels?

Reviews.Title: “decent place, good location”
Reviews.Author: kenito799
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June 2006. We booked thru go-today so breakfast was included--take a pass, it was useless (American coffee in thermal carafes! yuck!). The hotel is in a good location in Eixample, about four (large) blocks from Plaza Catalunya and we walked down to the Ramblas, Ribera, Gothic area, and to the gay section of Eixample quite easily. It is one block from Passeig de Gracia so it is a chic location, two blocks from Gaudi's Casa Batllo and walkable to La Pedrera. There are good tapas places within a few blocks, but we did most of our eating in Ribera so if in Barcelona again we would probably look for a place in the old city. However, this is an excellent location for Eixample which is very spread out so we were pretty happy with the location. The hotel has a fading four-star business class feel--would have been 4 stars in the 70s which is probably when the rooms were renovated. The 70s luxe feel is kind of nice in a kitschy way. The rooms are clean and bathrooms fine. We had a street-facing room but thick windows and drapes meant we could keep it quiet and dark whenever we wanted. The bathroom had a problem with hot water--too much--the cold water was a trickle. This wasn't a problem for a hot shower but if you wanted to cool off after walking around in muggy Barcelona it was a bit hard to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ub44
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my wife. The best thing of the hotel is its location, near shops, Pl. Catalonia and all means of transportation you might need. Staff is friendly and helpful when required. Rooms are good in size and confort but bathrooms could have some refurbishement (they are ok, but perhaps 3 stars category). Common areas are nice, with a bar and restaurant. Free internet on your room if you take the PC. Breakfast has a good range of offer but servants could be more polite here... TIP: if you do not have your pc with you but need to use the web, do not use the hotel's paid computer (3,50 eur for 15 minutes) - there is a web cafe 2 minutes away, ask the reception, they will help you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Lorna7
Reviews.Content: The HCC ST Moritz is in a great location in Barcelona - central enough for all the sites, but quiet enough to allow you to get some sleep. The rooms are spacious, particularly for a European hotel and are well maintained. The bathroom is really clean and well stocked. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is fine, but nothing special and unless included in the room price, I wouldn't pay extra for it. The lounge area is slightly disappointing. There is no atmosphere and not somewhere you would rush back to at the end of an evening. These slight negatives do not however, outweigh the fact that this hotel is clean, friendly and in a great location. I would certainly stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would hope for”
Reviews.Author: chrispaps
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel very recently for 3 nights. The location of the hotel is just north of la ramblas (about a 3 minute walk), and there is a major metro station 1 minute walk away, so the location of it is great. We also found most of the staff very friendly and helpful (even the security guards were pleasant), although there was one miserable looking lady with what seemed like a bit of an attitude behind the desk, although she didnt serve us. There is a small but nice bar just behind the reception desk, and a medium sized restuarant for dinner and breakfast. We didnt have dinner there but breakfast had pretty much everything we could ask for and the food seemed fresh and clean. Our room was a nice size and very comfortable, although the double-bed was, as other reviewers have stated, two singles put together, which, although odd, still works if you dont mind that kind of thing, as the beds are very comfortable. The shower is nice enough and the bathroom a nice size. So all in all I can't really criticise this place. Its fairly priced, has a lovely location and has everything you would expect and hope for. I recommend it.
